getSortedLigandList

public java.util.List<CMLAtom> getSortedLigandList()
Computes a ligand list and sorts the ligands in it by atomic number if two ligands have the same atomic number their order is unchanged.

Returns:
a sorted ligand list.

getSingleLigand

public CMLAtom getSingleLigand()
convenience method to get single atom ligand. useful for R graoups know to have single attachment

Returns:
the single atom (null if zero or > 1 ligands

recursiveCompare

public int recursiveCompare(CMLAtom otherAtom)
Compares this atom to another atom using simple CIP prioritization, if both atoms are the same it then looks at both atoms ligands and recurses until a mismatch is found. if thisAtom has higher priority return 1 if thisAtom and otherAtom have equal priority return 0 if otherAtom has higher priority return -1

Parameters:
otherAtom - CMLAtom to compare this atom with
Returns:
the comparision

addCalculatedCoordinatesForHydrogens

add calculated coordinates for hydrogens.

Parameters:
control - 2D or 3D

getLoneElectronCount

public int getLoneElectronCount()
                         throws CMLException
gets lone electrons on atom. electrons not involved in bonding assumes accurate hydrogen count only currently really works for first row (C, N, O, F) calculated as getHydrogenValencyGroup() - (getSumNonHydrogenBondOrder() + getHydrogenCount()) - atom.getFormalCharge()

Returns:
number of lone electrons (< 0 means cannot calculate)
Throws:
CMLException

getAtomWithLowestId

public static CMLAtom getAtomWithLowestId(java.util.List<CMLAtom> atomList)
finds atom with lowest lexical id.

Parameters:
atomList -
Returns:
atom

translateToCovalentRadius

public void translateToCovalentRadius()
translates an atom with single ligand to the covalent radius. in a bond (say C-R) where R has only one ligand will translate R along the bond vector to be at a distance CR where CR is covalent radious of the other atom (in this case C)
